00045 package opensonata.dataDisplays;
00046 
00047 import java.io.*;
00048 import java.util.*;
00049 
00053 public class EnvReader
00054 {
00055     private Map envMap;
00056 
00060     public EnvReader()
00061     {
00062         envMap = getEnvironment();   
00063     }
00064 
00065     // returns the value of the given environment variable,
00066     // or null if it does not exist.
00074     public String getEnvVar(String envVarName)
00075     {
00076         return (String) envMap.get(envVarName);
00077     }
00078 
00084     private Map getEnvironment()
00085     {
00086         Map map = new HashMap();
00087 
00088         try 
00089         {
00090             // OS-specific command: (UNIX)
00091             String cmd[] = { "/bin/sh", "-c", "env" };
00092             Process pid = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(cmd);
00093 
00094             BufferedReader in =
00095                 new BufferedReader(
00096                         new InputStreamReader(
00097                             pid.getInputStream()));
00098 
00099             for (;;) 
00100             {
00101 
00102                 // read through all the lines, breaking them
00103                 // into name, value pairs,
00104                 // and store them in the map.
00105 
00106                 String line = in.readLine();
00107                 if (line == null) break;
00108                 int p = line.indexOf("=");
00109                 if (p != -1) 
00110                 {
00111                     String key = line.substring(0, p);
00112                     String value = line.substring(p+1);
00113                     map.put(key, value);
00114                 }
00115 
00116             }
00117 
00118         }
00119         catch ( IOException e)
00120         {
00121             System.out.println("getEnvironment IO Exception");
00122         }
00123 
00124 
00125         return map;
00126     }
00127 
00128 
00135     public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
00136     {
00137         if (args.length > 0)
00138         {
00139             String envVarName = args[0];
00140             EnvReader env = new EnvReader();
00141 
00142             String value = env.getEnvVar(envVarName);
00143             if (value == null) {
00144                 System.out.println(envVarName + " not found");
00145             }
00146             else {
00147                 System.out.println(envVarName + "=" + value);
00148             }
00149         }
00150         else
00151         {
00152             System.out.println("give env var to display");
00153         }
00154     }
00155 
00156 }
